    • Method Detail

      • deleteElectionOutputFiles

        public static void deleteElectionOutputFiles()
        A helper function for the unit tests that will delete any instance of a Media Report or an OPL Audit File from the current working directory

      • createBasicPartyInstance

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Party> createBasicPartyInstance​(int numParties,
                                                                  int[] numCandidatesPerParty)
        Helper function for many different unit tests. Creates a basic party list with candidates populated. Party names will be p0, p1, ..., p<numParties - 1> Candidate names for each party will be c0_<party name>, c1_<party name>, ..., c<numCandidatesPerParty[index] - 1>_<party name>
        Parameters:
        numParties - The total parties that will be created.
        numCandidatesPerParty - An array of the number of candidates for each party that will be created. Should be the same size as numParties
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of Parties that are populated with candidates.

      • setPartyAndCandidateVotes

        public static void setPartyAndCandidateVotes​(java.util.ArrayList<Party> parties,
                                             int[] partyVotes,
                                             int[][] candidateVotes)
        Sets the party and candidate votes to certain values as indicated by parameters.
        Parameters:
        parties - The parties that we are initializing the votes for.
        partyVotes - The array of ints that correspond to the number of votes each party earns. For example, partyVotes[i] corresponds to the number of votes that party parties.get(i) receives.
        candidateVotes - The 2-D array of ints that corresponds to the number of votes each candidate gets for each party. For example, candidateVotes[i][j] corresponds to the number of votes that candidate parties.get(i).getCandidates().get(j) receives.

      • getAllFileContents

        public static java.lang.String getAllFileContents​(java.lang.String filename)
        Gets all the contents from a file and returns the contents as a string. Returns null if there was an issue with inputting the file.
        Parameters:
        filename - Filename of the file you want the contents of
        Returns:
        the contents of the file

      • findAuditAndMedia

        public static java.lang.String[] findAuditAndMedia()
        Finds the references to an audit and media file output and returns filenames associated with them. This function assumes there are only one audit and media file in the current directory. Filename will be null if an audit or media file was not found.
        Returns:
        the filename associated with the media and audit file. Arg 0 is media, and Arg 1 is audit.
